requirements: minimum of three years of Hill experience
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Texas ties are a plus though not necessary

key_responsibilities: answering constituent phone calls
greeting visitors
leading Capitol tours
assisting the staff by performing various tasks
requirements: excellent oral and written communication skills

key_responsibilities: developing and implementing the Member’s legislative priorities
advising her on various issues
managing the legislative agenda
requirements: excellent oral and written communication skills
the ability to work well under pressure
an extensive knowledge of the legislative process
the availability to work long hours
proven knowledge of legislative and political processes

key_responsibilities: responding to constituent mail
monitoring House floor procedures
assisting the legislative director with drafting legislation
meeting with constituents and interested individuals/organizations
preparing congressional record entries
assisting the communications director with updating the website and social media pages
other duties as assigned
requirements: resident of, or be willing to become, a resident of the District of Columbia

key_responsibilities: Acts as the representative for the Congresswoman within his or her area of responsibility including answering casework correspondence, meeting with constituents, verbal communications with constituents, and serving as a liaison with federal, district, and local agencies
Informs the Congresswoman and the District Director of all happenings in his or her assigned issue areas by screening district media sources and interacting with constituents
Acts as a liaison to local, state and federal officials and other persons or groups to form effective relationships for the Member
Manages at least 1 casework assignment area & assesses casework for problems requiring legislative action and makes recommendations to the District Director and/or Chief of Staff
Monitors scheduled district meetings for the Member with constituents
Screens and refers cases, when appropriate, to other district offices
Prepares periodic reports for the District Director on pending cases and district activities in his or her assigned geographic & issue areas
Continually screens active cases and acts as liaison with constituents to ensure that their cases are handled in a responsive manner
Maintains up-to-date files on all cases and categories of information of importance to the office
Performs other duties as assigned
requirements: experience with the military & veteran’s issues preferred
Exceptional written & oral communication, organizational and project management skills with an overall execution orientation; track record of effectively managing complex, multi-stakeholder projects
Thorough knowledge of legislative process and of House organization and procedures
Thorough knowledge of local, state and federal agencies and departments
Knowledge of all issues and events in the district in which the Congresswoman is involved
Strong political instincts, and a proactive entrepreneurial mindset
Grace under pressure; ability to delegate, communicate, and act decisively as well as adapt well to changing priorities
Availability & ability to work long, irregular hours including evenings and weekends
A professional style that includes flexibility, evenness, and sense of humor

office: House Committee on Energy and Commerce, Subcommittee on Oversight & Investigations
position: Oversight and Investigations Committee Staff Position
key_responsibilities: staffing Congressional hearings
overseeing federal agencies
conducting research and investigations
writing and editing
conducting document review and analysis
requirements: Areas of expertise under the Committee’s jurisdiction preferred, including environment, energy, public health and cyber security
Background in investigations and oversight a plus
Five years of professional experience and J.D. preferred but not required, as experience within the areas of the Committee’s public issue area jurisdiction may be equally relevant

key_responsibilities: Maintain the Member’s schedule in DC
Plan and schedule the Member’s meetings, events, speaking arrangements, and travel
Transport the Member on official business
Administer office purchasing, technology, and staff travel
Hire, train, and manage the office intern program
requirements: able to function in a fast-paced team-environment

key_responsibilities: developing long-term and short-term digital plans and strategies
creating, drafting and posting content on all platforms
creating graphics, video and other sharable content
managing and growing the Congressman’s e-newsletter program

key_responsibilities: cultivating strategic relationships with community leaders and constituent groups
developing and executing an outreach plan for the district
coordinating events and initiatives that will promote services that the office provides
organizing events that relate to the Congressman’s legislative and district priorities
monitoring and updating office leadership on local district issues
recruiting and managing office interns
staffing the Congressman at various events and meetings in the district
working on nights and weekends as needed

a spirit of teamwork and service
Virginia ties and related experience preferred

the ability to exercise sound, independent judgment
the ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others

key_responsibilities: manage and coordinate all media and public relations activities
developing and executing integrated communications plans
collaborating effectively with colleagues
implementing all public relations strategies

responding to and managing media inquiries from diverse media outlets

excellent written and oral communication skills
able to develop a keen understanding of the unique priorities and views of the district and find ways to advance the Member’s objectives

work cooperatively and courteously with others
temperament to communicate with a variety of personalities in a tactful, pleasant, and professional manner
